page.title: 20Carlton on Trent
page.content: Carlton on Trent is a picturesque little village,lying between the Trent to the East and the Old Great North Road to the West(A.1.).The houses in the main are brick built cottages ranging in age from 300 years old to present day Council houses. The church is Victorian,built on the site of an ancient chapel(Norwell).The Main St. is dominated by beautiful Georgian houses.There is a delightful blacksmith's shop,with an interesting horseshoe-shaped doorway.Carlton Hall, the Manor House, is still occupied by the Vere-Laurie family,formerly Squires of the village.Previously the village had a Malsters Industry,but now there is no industry at all in the village.Carlton was one of the old crossing points of the Trent,(ferry to Holme,E. of the river).It is now a residential, dormant village.
